page.title: 05The land to the east of area
page.content: We drove down Betty Bells lane,it was a bumpy ride over the ruts.We think it was probably a cart-track.Then we came to land owned by Mr.N.Bell.Most of this land was used as grassland ,about 85% of it.The other was used for crops,linseed,oilseed rape,barley,wheat and peas.The fields were mostly divided by stake fencing. Next we came to a large field of 24 acres.It was probably big bacause it had had a hedge taken out to allow the machines to work more easily. There were a few wild flowers in the hedge bottoms,a few poppies,violas and alot of cow parsley and nettles!
